Class Golfer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Golfer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Golfer>

    public class Golfer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Golfer>
    Objects of this class represent a single golfer and their attributes: Name, number of rounds played, handicap, and average score Standard accessor/mutator functions are provided for all attributes. Additionally, a method for adding a new score to a golfer and recomputing their average score is provided.

      Construct a new Golfer object by specifying all attributes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Golfer

        public Golfer(java.lang.String name)
        Construct a new Golfer object with a name and all-zero stats. This is useful when specifying a golfer for a generic class method that performs search.
        Parameters:
        name - golfer name
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if parameter name is a null String reference
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if parameter name is all whitespace or an empty string
        Precondition:
        String name is not null
        Postcondition:
        new Golfer object created with specified name and all-zero stats

      • Golfer

        public Golfer(java.lang.String name,
              int rounds,
              int handicap,
              double avg)
        Construct a new Golfer object by specifying all attributes.
        Parameters:
        name - golfer name
        rounds - number of rounds played by golfer
        handicap - player's handicap
        avg - player's average score
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if parameter name is a null String reference
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
        • if name is all whitespace or an empty string
        • if rounds < 0
        • if handicap < 0
        • if avg < 0.00
        Precondition:
        • parameter name is not null
        • parameter rounds is a positive int >= 0
        • parameter handicap is a positive int >= 0
        • parameter avg is a positive double >= 0.00
        Postcondition:
        new Golfer object created with specified attributes

    • Method Detail

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Golfer g)
        Compare this Golfer to another Golfer by name, return 0 if both Golfers have the same name; return int < 0 if this Golfer's name comes alphabetically before; return int > 0 if this Golfer's name comes alphabetically after.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Golfer>
        Parameters:
        g - Golfer object to compare this to
        Precondition:
        parameter g is a non-null reference to a Golfer object
